TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AssemblyInfo extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: References an assembly to be linked to during compilation of a dynamic resource. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET automatically links assemblies to a resource when compiling each code module. An <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyInfo> object references an assembly. An assembly is a collection of types and resources that are built to work together and form a logical unit of functionality. An assembly provides the common language runtime with the information it needs to identify type implementations. To the runtime, a type does not exist outside the context of an assembly.
Commonly linked assemblies are listed in the `assemblies` node of the `compilation` section of the configuration. Additionally, assemblies can be manually added to a code resource when additional functionality for an application is needed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string assemblyName) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies a comma-separated assembly name combination consisting of version, culture, and public-key tokens.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of an class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyInfo> instance is not initialized with assembly information, an exception is thrown.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyInfo> object. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyCollection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyCollection/CS/AssemblyCollection.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.AssemblyCollection/VB/AssemblyCollection.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an assembly reference to use during compilation of a dynamic resource.
Docs.value: A comma-separated string value specifying the version, culture, and public-key tokens of an assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET first searches for the assembly DLL in the application's private Bin directory and then in the system assembly cache.
